value.0: Congratulations, you have reached the last room.  There's some magic coins on the floor for you.  The last thing I will tell you is how to set up a campsite so you can rest.

Campsites are created from items in your inventory.  The better the campsite you create, the more hitpoints you can recover from resting.  You can set tents, build campfires, and sleep on bedrolls.  With each campsite feature, the amount of healing will increase because of a better quality rest.

If you prefer doing things manually, you can set each campsite item individually.  For example, you can place some firewood on the ground and use your tinderbox on the logs to start a campfire.  You could use your tent and target an empty section of ground to raise it.  If you have a bedroll, it will be used automatically.

The 'easy' way to set up camp is to make sure you have some of the items required in your inventory, whether it be a tent, or some firewood and tinderbox, or just a bedroll.  You can activate your Player Action Widget and target a section of ground.  If you are OUTDOORS and have the correct items, the widget will create the best possible campsite for you, given the items in your pack. INDOORS you'll have to do set up your site manually.
To rest, you need to find one more secret door.  Beyond it lies a room where you can get wood from the tree and set up a campsite.  Good Luck!
You have successfully completed this demo. Would you like to purchase some items?

The C.R.A.P. Development Team spent a lot of time on this project and we hope it saves you time and makes things fun.  All we ask for in return is your vote on the Vault.

Thank You
Computer Rolepaying Adaptation Project Team
There's a hill giant behind the big door to your right.  If you are worried about pursuit or need to keep a door open or closed you can do so with your Player Action Widget.
If you have iron spikes and a spike mallet in your inventory you can target the door with your Player Action Widget to recieve an option to 'spike the door shut' or 'spike the door open'.
Once you've eliminated the threat of the Giant by spiking the door, you need to use your Player Action Widget to jump over that pile of rubble that blocks the hallway.
What would you like to purchase?
Three doors to choose from. One is safe, one is trapped, and the other has some monsters behind it.

Use your Player Action Widget to target each of the doors in turn.  Detect traps on the doors and listen at them next.  You should be able to find the door that is trapped and then hear the beasts behind the other one.  In this way, you can determine which door is safe to pass through.  You can also use the widget in the same way to detect traps on chests, or to search an object for hidden compartments.
Do you want to buy something?

Activate your grappling hook and target a rope in your inventory.  That will attach the grappling hook to the rope.  Now you can activate your rope and grappling hook to attempt to catch the hook on the nearest pit edge.  If there is no pit edge nearby, try moving to a different spot and trying again.

There is a pit edge right above me.

To continue, you'll need to get past that pit.  You can either jump over it or climb down and out again. There's a magic coin hidden in the bottom of the pit and if you want to get to the bottom safely, you're going to need a rope and iron spikes.  You will also need a grappling hook to get back up the other side of the pit once your down there. Please note that shorter Races will NOT be able to jump the pit.
You can buy ropes, grappling hooks, spikes, and a spike mallet from me.  Would you like to purchase some items?
<StartAction>The magic mouth sticks it's magic tongue out at you.</Start>
If you have rope, spikes, and spike mallet in your inventory you can use those items on a pit in one of two ways.
One, you can just click and activate the rope when you are standing near the pit.  You will automatically use your mallet to drive the iron spikes into the pit edge and attach the rope.
Two, you can activate your Player Action Widget and target the pit to recieve an option to do the same thing.

Use your Player Action Widget.  Stand close to the edge of the pit and use your widget to target the floor on the other side of the pit where you would like to jump to.  You will get the option to jump.
What would you like to purchase?
You need to use your 'Player Action Widget' to help find your way out of this manor.  Along the way you should look for magic coins hidden about.

Start by opening your inventory.  Inside you'll see a bag marked Widgets & Tomes.  Inside that bag you'll find your Player Action Widget.  Click and drag the widget to one of your hot slots at the bottom of your screen and keep it there.  You'll use it frequently.

Near me you'll see two curtains, one red, one brown.  There is a magic coin hidden in the room behind the red curtain.  To search for it, click your hotslot button for the Player Action Widget and target a section of floor in the room.  You will get the option to search the area.  If you find the coin, you'll recieve a bonus when you activate it.  There is also a crate below me. Use your widget on it to find the coin hidden within.
After you've found the coin, search for a secret door in the small office behind the brown curtain.  That is your path to the next area.
If you forget what to do, or just enjoy my witty coversation, come speak to me again.
No
Yes.
How do I do that?
I want to buy something.
I want to view the full store.

No, I want to know how I can use a grappling hook and rope to climb out the other side of this pit.
I don't need any more of your help.
How do I use a rope to get down into the pit?
No, I'll just jump the pit but I need to know how to do that?
Yes
